creator: FabianoMazza
title: Typewriter Turned Plotter
materials_required: Cheap, used electronic typewriter with stepper motors
Small tin can stepper with reduction gear from an old scanner
CNC shield with A4988 motor drivers
Universal G-code Sender (UGS) Platform running on a PC
Slim DVD ROM drive (for Z axis)
description: This project repurposes a cheap, used electronic typewriter into a plotter controlled by an Arduino and GRBL. It involves modifying the typewriter's carriage for finer resolution and adding a Z-axis mechanism to lift and lower a pen.
steps: Choose an electronic typewriter with stepper motors for paper feed, carriage, and daisywheel movement.

Address the carriage resolution issue by adding a small tin can stepper with reduction gear from an old scanner. Glue the pinion from the original motor to the output gear of the scanner assembly to add reduction gears.

Set up the software and hardware: Use an Arduino UNO running standard GRBL, a CNC shield with A4988 motor drivers, a 12V power supply, and Universal G-code Sender (UGS) Platform on a PC. Add limit switches for safety and homing.

Implement Z-axis movement (pen up/down) by disassembling a slim DVD ROM drive and using its frame, rails, and a metal piece. Connect a string from the daisywheel motor disk through a pulley to a pen carriage. Adjust travel limits in UGS.
